intro: Iliamna latibracteata, commonly known as the narrowleaf willow or Sitka willow, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its slender, often multi-stemmed form and lance-shaped leaves that are typically 3–8 inches long. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in catkins, which are clustered in dense, cylindrical structures. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils along streams, rivers, and wetlands. Iliamna latibracteata plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
